intro: Blakea ovalis, commonly known as the oval leaf blakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an epiphyte on trees in humid, shaded environments. Blakea ovalis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
